topic.title: Zero Net Not Working On FireFox
topic.body:
So I'm currently using Chrome which seems to load everything properly. But if I use FireFox I get teh following error for any .bit site I try to load:

The following error was encountered while trying to retrieve the URL: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HeLLo4uzjaLetFx6NH3PMwFP3qbRbTf3D

    Connection to 127.0.0.1 failed.

The system returned: (111) Connection refused

The remote host or network may be down. Please try the request again.

Your cache administrator is webmaster.

topic.title: Is there a crypto exchange on zeronet?
Crypto Exchange
topic.body:
Is it hard to get the necessary licences in the USA to operate a cryptocurrency exchange?

And if anyone knows, what licenses specifically are require to operate a cryptocurrency exchange in the US?

1521086067_152jxyDu7V8pxqTh31rc1n8tqPD1N.body:
> [sylvaine](#comment_26_1F9qtxgSgbkeJX7NT2BARwR8XCn1XP4qPG): Nope, but there probably should be one. Good idea!Â As long as you have a positive/negative rating system for traders. Fraud may be rampant during the early stages.. depending on where the forces of chaos feel like taking us.

I think as long as there's a trade rep system and an escrow, it would work well enough as long as people are mildly cautious

> [koolkidkristi](#comment_15_12rGah2WFY4XFcASwmT9THLBVB7gWakhKr): It's possible to make and it probably wouldn't be too hard to make either. [...]

Yeah I'd do it, but I've already got my own exchange to worry about. Someone should definitely do this though
